reviewText: Finally managed to switch it over to english and the game is still terrible. Its flat out broken. The tutorial is useless, loading times take forever (even with just the US league selected), and the user interface is confusing and not straight forward. The AI is also awful and at time laughable, if I hadn't just paid $19 for this garbage. If you were buying this game expecting a Football Manger game just for basketball, you will be sadly disappointed. I want my money back. To say that this is even an Alpha is a lie.
voteText: 320 of 357 people (90%) found this review helpful

reviewText: I ignored the reviews and it was a terrible idea. There are free games on steam better than this game. All the names are spelt incorrectly, including school names. You have to guess what team you are playing because it only tells you the town name. For college, which is the reason I got the game, there are very few options for you to do. There is training and subbing during games. That's about it. There are no fast breaks, and if rebounded down low, they always kick it back out to the point guard to set up the play again rather than just taking the post shot. I honestly wish I could get my money back. Even for simple visuals for a simulation management game, they look like something from 10 years ago. There are very few options for defense, which is something I was looking forward to utilizing in the game. I believe if you are going to release a game and put it in English, you should at least know how to spell in English first. Do not spend a dime on this game.

reviewText:
I tried this game a number of times as I am a big fan of management type games. I found this one a bit difficult to work with mostly the biggest problem I have with it is the contract system I think because it is using the euro for its currency I think it would be much better if you could choose other currencies such as the us dollar they do have tutorials that does explain a good portion of the game. Other than the currency being in the euro I had a bit of difficulty  finding and contacting free agents that could have been better handled such as having the option under the league that you are in or under national instead of under world also would have been better off if they had a section for free agents and then a section for scouts to contact the college students instead they are all thrown in together including players that are already signed to other teams or other leagues so it makes it difficult to  find free agents and to assign scouts to college players.

It would also be better if they had an option to assign scouts to monitor specific areas and go ont here own to scout players  instead of just having to assign scouts to to players also having a place to go to view the top 25 college prospects as well as each scouts top 25 prospects would be nice.maybe a whole section for scouting. Also seems to load and save very slowly even when you don't select more then one organization it still is very long  load and save times for a game that is not very graphical it boggles the mind at the slowness of it.

reviewText:
As a fan and a player of basketball, i was always frustrated seeing that there was no game for basketball simulation unlike football (yeah it's called football and not soccer).
It's true, that this game is not perfect but considering that it is developed by few students, i found it pretty good actually.
I think that the true fans of basketball will appreciate to manage in every detail a team and notice that every decision made influences the game and the team.
For football fans who don't know a lot about basketball, stick to football manager, or NBA 2K if you just want to press buttons on your gamepad and feel like you are playing basketball.
